free_text.Learning outcomes: [li]	To understand key issues and methodological aspects in system design [br/][li]	To learn theory and methods for modelling, verifying and designing systems[br/][li]	To outline strengths and limitations of formal methods and learn how they can be  effectively applied  in system design[br/]
free_text.Content: [li]	Executable models for the description of reactive systems such as process algebras, Petri nets, timed Automata and hybrid systems with emphasis on their semantics and properties.  [br/][br/][li]	Requirements specification languages such as temporal logics and process algebras, and their semantic foundations.[br/][br/][li]	Verification and synthesis techniques and their application for checking/enforcing correctness with respect to given requirements. [br/][br/][li]	Examples of existing model-based design flows and supporting tools.[br/]
